statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Loyola Marymount 72, San Francisco 67
article.story: LOS ANGELES (AP) -- Loyola Marymount beat San Francisco 72-67 Monday, sending coach Eddie Sutton's team to defeat in the game after a huge comeback earned him his 800th career victory. Shawn Deadwiler scored 18 points for the Lions (5-18, 2-5 West Coast Conference), who snapped a four-game losing streak. Earlier in the day Sutton became the winningest active coach in major men's college basketball with the resignation of Bob Knight from Texas Tech. On Saturday he had become just the fifth coach to reach 800 wins with a victory over Pepperdine. Knight has 902 victories. The Dons (6-16, 2-5) have lost 8 of 10 games since Sutton arrived to take over for Jessie Evans late last year. They have lost 11 of 14 road games this season. Deadwiler went 4-for-9 from 3-point range and also had seven rebounds. He made a 3-pointer to finish an 11-0 run that opened the second half and gave Loyola Marymount a 48-37 lead with 15:03 remaining. San Francisco cut the lead to 71-67 on a basket by Manny Quezada with 7.7 seconds left, but Tim Diederichs made one two of two free throws in the final seconds to save the Lions' win. Diederichs scored 16 points and Corey Counts had 11 points and eight assists. Orlando Johnson added another 11 points for the Lions. Dior Lowhorn and Quezada each scored 20 points each for the Dons. Lowhorn, the conference's leading scorer who played for Knight at Texas Tech before transferring to San Francisco, also pulled down 10 rebounds.
